input2:
A woman is with tracheobronchomalacia, with esophageal manometry and pH studies concerning for significant disease. She is being seen this afternoon to discuss management. 
Prior to the GI studies she had to suspend her PPI for 7 days, during which she reports persistent burning chest pain and globus sensation, both of which have resolved with restarting her PPI.
She has an intermittently productive cough and is currently
finishing a course of antibiotics for a presumed URI.
